details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Moving Pictures → MI-02. Play and Illusion → MI-02-C02

results.title: VFX in Peter Rabbit
results.credit_line:
PR1: PETER RABBIT and all associated characters ™ & © Frederick Warne & Co Limited. PETER RABBIT™, the Movie ©2018 Columbia Pictures Industries, Inc. All Rights Reserved.
PR2: PETER RABBIT and all associated characters ™ & © Frederick Warne & Co Limited. PETER RABBIT™ 2:The Runaway, the Movie ©2021 Columbia Pictures Industries, Inc. All Rights Reserved.
results.brief_description: A look at how acclaimed VFX studio Animal Logic bought Beatrix Potter’s Peter Rabbit to life.

constellations_primary.name: VFX to fantasy and freedom
constellations_primary.description: Founded in Sydney, and now with offices worldwide, Animal Logic are an Academy Award-winning VFX and animation studio whose job is to bring the impossible to life. And they're in good company with these other artists and filmmakers.

results.description: First springing from the mind of Beatrix Potter, Peter Rabbit is a creature that has captured the imagination of children for more than a century. So there was plenty of pressure when it came to bringing the beloved character to life on the big screen. Animal Logic rose to the occasion, with the Australian company having to get inventive. To achieve a seamless hybrid of live action and animation for Peter Rabbit (2018), they used prop rabbits during the shoot so cast members had a tangible property to interact with. In post-production, the Prop Peters were replaced with an animated version by visual effect artists.
description_for_label: Beatrix Potter’s Peter Rabbit has captured the imagination of children for more than a century. So there was plenty of pressure when it came to bringing the character to life on the big screen. Animal Logic rose to the occasion, with the Australian company having to get inventive. To achieve a seamless hybrid of live-action and animation for Peter Rabbit, they used prop rabbits during the shoot for cast members to interact with. In post-production, the Prop Peters were replaced with an animated version by visual effect artists.
results.credit_line_for_label:
PETER RABBIT™ & © FW&Co. PETER RABBIT™ Movie © 2021 CPII All Rights Reserved

Special thanks to Columbia Pictures

results.title: Tripoli Melbourne & Me!
results.creator_credit: Dania Dabliz, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dania Dabliz’s life in Tripoli was full of fun, friends and parties. When she migrated to Melbourne she wondered if she would find the same things again?

results.title: Where Do I Belong?
results.creator_credit: Rita el-Khoury, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Rita el-Khoury travels to Lebanon every year. She calls Australia and Lebanon her home but it wasn’t until she was caught in the middle of the 2006 Israeli bombing of Beiruit that she fully appreciated what that meant.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rita el-Khoury, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Spaces in Between
results.creator_credit: Carla Pascoe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Carla Pascoe traces her family’s ancestry from Lebanon and contemplates the mysterious circumstances of her great grandfather’s migration, as well as the undocumented moments of her family’s history.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Carla Pascoe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Loving Lebanon and Australia
results.creator_credit: Sam Haddad, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Lebanese immigrant Sam Haddad migrated to Australia he encountered ignorance and racism but via a well timed punch, he learned the value of mateship and tolerance and began to love his adopted country.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Haddad, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: When Lebanese immigrant Sam Haddad migrated to Australia he encountered ignorance and racism but via a well timed punch, he learned the value of mateship and tolerance and began to love his adopted country.
description_for_label: When Lebanese immigrant Sam Haddad migrated to Australia he encountered ignorance and racism but via a well timed punch, he learned the value of mateship and tolerance and began to love his adopted country.
